document.docAuthor: Lofego, Antonio C. & Feres, Reinaldo J. F.
document.docTitle: Typhlodromus moraesi Lofego & Feres, 2006, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Typhlodromus Scheuten (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Typhlodromus Scheuten (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype female, from
Tabebuia alba (Cham.) Sandwith.
( Bignoniaceae ),
March 24 , 2000
, UNESP Campus ( 20 º 47 ’03” S, 49 º 21 ’ 36 ” W), São José do Rio Preto, São Paulo, Brazil , M. R. Bellini coll.. Paratypes :
3 females
and
1 male
,
March 27, 2001
;
1 male
,
November 28 , 2000
;
1 male
,
January 29, 2001
, same host, type locality and collector as holotype ;
1 female
,
Chamaesyce hirta
(L.) Millsp. ( Euphorbiaceae ),
April 14 , 2000
, Pindorama ( 21 º 13 ’ 43 ” S, 48 º 54 ’ 54 ” W), São Paulo, Brazil , M.A. Nunes coll..

This species differs from
T . arizonicus
by having setae Z 4 and Z 5 serrate; the calyx of the spermatheca more elongate; ventri­anal shield of the female subquadrate and smooth; and by the absence of macrosetae on tarsus IV.
Peritreme : Extending forward to the level of j 1 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–7.
Typhlodromus moraesi
sp. nov.
1–5. Female: 1. dorsal shield, 2. ventral idiosoma, 3. chelicera, 4, spermathecae, 5. leg IV (genu, tibia and basitarsus). 6–7. Male: 6, ventri­anal shield, 7. chelicera.

subSubSection.paragraph: Peritreme : Extending forward to level of j 3 .
Legs : Macrosetae absent; chaetotaxy of genua II and III as in females.
